title: AI To Replace Customer Service Jobs First: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman

title: GST 2.0 To Kick In From Monday, Goods And Services To Get Cheaper

title: 'Trying To Put Toothpaste Back In Tube': Ex-Diplomat On H-1B Visa Fee Hike Clarification

title: Watch: Trump‚Äôs H-1B visa order | Explained
content: Employers will now need to pay $100,000 (around ‚Çπ83 lakh) annually for each H-1B employee, making renewals a costly decision. The move, officials say, is aimed at ensuring only highly skilled workers are hired while boosting U.S. revenue. For Indian professionals, who make up the majority of H-1B holders, the change raises uncertainty around jobs and green card hopes. A proposed 25% outsourcing tax could add further pressure on India‚Äôs $220 billion IT export industry.

title: $100k H-1B fees higher than salaries of many professionals: L-1 visas an alternative?
content: The Trump administration's $100,000 H-1B visa fee hike is poised to significantly impact the Indian IT sector. Companies may explore L-1 visas, but these face limitations and increased scrutiny. Experts warn of workforce departures, offshore job movement, and a potential boost for countries like India.

title: IND vs PAK drama! Pakistan cancel press conference; Mohsin Naqvi's three-word reply sparks buzz
content: Amidst handshake controversy and tensions with the ICC match referee, PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi visited Pakistan's training session before their Asia Cup Super Fours clash against India. Naqvi engaged in an intense discussion with coach Mike Hesson, following the cancellation of Pakistan's pre-match press conference. The visit occurs after Pakistan sought the removal of Andy Pycroft over a handshake dispute.

title: Rift widens in Lalu family as Rohini unfollows RJD, kin

title: H-1B visa hike: Zoho founder to Indians in US; ‚ÄòDo not live in fear‚Äô
content: Following the significant H-1B visa fee increase announced by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is encouraging Indian tech professionals in America to return to India. Drawing parallels with the Partition, Vembu assures them that rebuilding their lives in India will ultimately lead to success, given the country's burgeoning opportunities and thriving tech ecosystem.

title: ‚ÄòZero civic sense‚Äô: Tourists 'vandalise' Humayun‚Äôs Tomb in Delhi
content: A video showing visitors allegedly vandalising Humayun's Tomb, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, has sparked outrage online. The footage shows a young man scribbling on a wall while others film. While some shots appear to be from other locations, ASI officials confirmed parts of the video were from the tomb.

title: H-1B visa rules: US clarifies Trump‚Äôs requirement; applies only to new applicants
content: USCIS clarified that Trump's new order imposing a $100,000 fee on H-1B visas applies only to new petitions filed after September 21, 2025. This is a one-time fee, not an annual charge, and does not affect existing H-1B visa holders or those with petitions filed before the specified date. The proclamation aims to address systemic abuse of H-1B visas.

title: 'Our cricket is in a pathetic state'- Former Pak player drops bombshell ahead of India clash
content: Following Pakistan's dismal performance against India in the Asia Cup, Danish Kaneria has strongly criticized the national team and its management. He highlighted the lack of accountability and strategic planning within Pakistan cricket. The controversy surrounding the handshake snub and calls for structural changes underscore the urgent need for improvement as they face India again in the Super 4s.

title: From Covid to Op Sindoor: PM Modi's speeches over the years; all eyes on 5pm address
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to address the nation at 5 pm on Sunday, as confirmed by the PMO. While the topic remains undisclosed, speculations suggest a focus on economic changes, coinciding with Navratri's start and upcoming GST reforms. Over his more than ten years in office, PM Modi has often addressed the nation to announce major decisions.

title: 'Will he address concerns or same talk again': Congress on PM Modi speech
content: Jairam Ramesh criticizes PM Modi, alleging that Donald Trump, Modi's "good friend," repeatedly claimed credit for halting Operation Sindoor by leveraging trade with America. Ramesh questions whether Modi will address deteriorating India-US relations, H1B holder concerns, or tariff-related livelihood risks during his address to the nation.

title: H-1B visa hike: JPMorgan asks staff to return to US before Sept 21
content: JPMorgan and Microsoft are urging H-1B visa holders to return to the U.S. immediately due to President Trump's new directive imposing a $100,000 annual fee on companies for each H-1B worker. This move, effective September 21st, is anticipated to disproportionately impact Indian IT firms like Infosys and TCS, who heavily rely on H-1B visas to deploy professionals in the U.S.

title: No mercy! Suryavanshi targets Australia bowlers - Watch
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old phenomenon, ignited India's chase of 225 against Australia U19 with a rapid 38 off 22 balls, including seven fours and a six. His aggressive start put the Australian bowlers under pressure early on. Despite a shaky start for the middle order after his dismissal, Suryavanshi's power-hitting became the highlight of India's innings.

title: Zubeen Garg‚Äôs final journey: Thousands bid farewell to Assam‚Äôs music icon
content: Assam mourns the loss of Zubeen Garg, its beloved singer, whose remains arrived in Guwahati on Sunday. Tens of thousands of fans lined the streets, paying their respects to the artist, who died in Singapore following a swimming accident. The outpouring of grief saw shops closed and citizens gathering to honor Garg, a cultural icon who recorded over 38,000 songs.

title: Bengaluru residents protest, demand pothole-free roads
content: Residents of Varthur and Gunjur are protesting for better roads. A recent death due to traffic has sparked outrage. People are demanding pothole-free and dust-free roads. The Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited road widening project is delayed. Alternative routes are also in poor condition. Residents are frustrated with daily struggles and demand immediate action. Police intervened in protests outside residences.

title: 4-year-old kidnapped, thrown off cliff by teen neighbor seeking revenge on boy‚Äôs mother
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Anand Parbat, a four-year-old boy is critically injured after being kidnapped and attacked by a 15-year-old neighbor. The teenager, seeking revenge against the boy's mother for a previous disciplinary action, lured the child to a secluded area, threw him off a cliff, and bludgeoned him with a rock.

title: Blindfolded cow pushed into drain; rescued by villagers in Haryana
content: In a disturbing incident near Jamal village, Sirsa, villagers discovered a cow blindfolded and struggling in a drain. Residents rescued the animal, which had been deliberately thrown into the water overnight. The cow is now under the care of the Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati Gaushala Committee, while villagers condemn the inhumane act and demand strict action against those responsible.

title: IND vs PAK showdown: Declaration - 'India will beat Pakistan in Super Four'
content: Monty Panesar believes the India-Pakistan handshake controversy has dampened enthusiasm for their Asia Cup Super 4 match. He urges both teams to prioritize cricket amid political tensions. Panesar predicts India will win the upcoming game. The reduced excitement reflects strained relations between the two nations. India previously defeated Pakistan by seven wickets.

title: 'Shahid Afridi dog meat khaata hai': Irfan Pathan‚Äôs brutal attack on Afridi
content: Irfan Pathan revealed a heated exchange with Shahid Afridi during a 2006 flight from Karachi to Lahore, where Afridi's condescending behavior sparked a verbal altercation. Pathan recounted how he cleverly silenced Afridi by humorously suggesting he had consumed dog meat after Afridi used abusive language.

title: Birthday bash turns tragic in Gujarat: 25-year-old stabbed to death by robber
content: In a tragic turn, Vaibhav Manwani's 25th birthday celebration ended in his fatal stabbing near Ahmedabad's Narmada canal. A robber attacked Manwani and his 23-year-old friend, who bravely ran 800 meters for help despite her own stab wounds. She is now stable in Civil Hospital.

title: Trump repeats 'Putin let me down'; pushes for pause on oil drilling
content: Donald Trump has once again criticized Vladimir Putin regarding the war in Ukraine, stating the Russian leader "let me down." Trump suggested that increasing oil production could lower prices and potentially halt the conflict. He also claimed the war wouldn't have occurred if he were still president, asserting Putin didn't respect President Biden's leadership, leading to the invasion.

title: Lucknow mall: Bouncer shot, many injured after party continued past closing time
content: A late-night dispute at a Lucknow mall's club escalated into violence when a group, including a doctor, clashed with bouncers after refusing to end their party. One of the men allegedly shot a bouncer, injuring him and a colleague. Enraged bouncers retaliated, assaulting the group. Police arrested four individuals and recovered a licensed pistol and ammunition.

title: PM Modi‚Äôs mother abused? BJP shares video of Tejashwi rally; RJD calls it doctored
content: Bihar's political scene is heating up again following accusations that Tejashwi Yadav's RJD rally insulted PM Modi's late mother, Heeraben Modi. This controversy follows similar allegations from Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs ‚ÄòVoter Adhikar Yatra‚Äô. BJP leaders have shared a video as evidence, while RJD denies the claims, alleging fabrication and audio manipulation by the BJP to defame Tejashwi Yadav.

title: ‚ÄòNo employer will pay $100K for me‚Äô: US H-1B visa fee hike sparks anxiety
content: A significant hike in US H-1B visa fees, potentially reaching $100,000 per employee, has sparked anxiety among Indian professionals and employers. Many Indians with scheduled visa stamping appointments are now in limbo, fearing they may be unable to return to their jobs in the US.

title: India vs WI Tests: BCCI secy confirms squad announcement date; 1st Test Oct 2
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India will announce the Indian squad for the upcoming two-Test series against the West Indies soon. The selection meeting will be held online. Shubman Gill will captain India in their first home series of the new World Test Championship cycle. West Indies have recalled Tagenarine Chanderpaul and Alick Athanaze.

title: Exclusive | From taunts to World Champion: Minakshi Hooda, Indian boxing's new face
content: Minakshi Hooda, a 24-year-old boxer from Haryana, overcame societal skepticism and financial hardships to win a gold medal at the 2025 World Boxing Championships in Liverpool. Her victory not only brought pride to India but also inspired young girls in her village to pursue sports, proving that dedication and perseverance can shatter stereotypes.

title: Hyderabad cabbie forces man to kneel, touch his feet over cancelled ride
content: In Hyderabad, a Rapido driver allegedly assaulted a passenger at AIG Hospital after a fare dispute. Balaji, the victim, cancelled the ride when the driver demanded extra money. The driver, along with associates, confronted Balaji, physically assaulted him, and filmed the incident.

title: Argentinian climber struck boulder, knocked out, then slipped again; body found
content: Matias Augusto Travizano, an Argentinian tech entrepreneur, tragically died after falling from Mount Shasta in California. Travizano had reached the summit with two other climbers. During the descent, he and another climber lost their way. They ended up on the Wintun Glacier. Travizano slipped and fell approximately 3,000 feet. A California Highway Patrol helicopter recovered his body. Officials warn climbers about the dangers of even the 'safer' routes.

title: ‚ÄòInexcusable‚Äô: UP man makes Insta reels inside Pocso courtroom, jailed
content: In Etah, a 25-year-old man faced consequences for creating Instagram reels during a sensitive trial involving kidnapping and gang rape within a special Pocso court. Constable Vineet Kumar noticed the man's actions, leading to intervention by Special Judge Narendra Pal Rana.

title: Eknath Shinde‚Äôs X account hacked; images of Pakistan, Turkey flags posted
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's X account was compromised on Sunday, with hackers posting images of Pakistani and Turkish flags. The incident occurred on the same day as the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match, prompting immediate action from cybercrime police. Authorities successfully regained control of the account within 30 to 45 minutes.

title: 'Did not publish on time': US flags Pakistan‚Äôs defence budgets; urges transparency
content: The US State Department's 2025 report urges Pakistan to enhance fiscal transparency by subjecting military and intelligence budgets to parliamentary oversight. While acknowledging progress in budget accessibility and auditing standards, the report criticizes limited debt disclosure and the absence of public access to executive budget proposals. These recommendations aim to bolster accountability and investor confidence amid Pakistan's fiscal challenges.

title: IND vs PAK: Should Arshdeep Singh play? Irfan Pathan questions India's plans
content: Irfan Pathan has sparked debate ahead of the crucial Asia Cup Super Four match between India and Pakistan, questioning whether Arshdeep Singh should be included in the playing XI. Pathan emphasizes the importance of a left-arm quick to partner with Jasprit Bumrah, especially under pressure and in wet conditions.

title: Watch: $100k H-1B visa fee triggers flight chaos in US among Indian travellers
content: Panic erupted among Indian H-1B visa holders in the US after President Trump's proclamation imposed a hefty $100,000 fee on petitions. Chaos unfolded at airports, with some passengers disembarking flights fearing reentry issues. Tech giants like Microsoft and Amazon reportedly advised employees to return to the US or avoid international travel.

title: Asia Cup clash: Ex-India captain slams Pakistan; calls them ‚Äòseventh-division team‚Äô
content: Following Pakistan's loss to India in the Asia Cup 2025, Krishnamachari Srikkanth has strongly criticized the Pakistan team, deeming them a weak opponent. He suggested they should compete with Associate nations instead of top-tier teams, questioning their place in prestigious tournaments. Srikkanth also criticized coach Mike Hesson's leadership, doubting Pakistan's future progress under him.

title: Watch: Family in 1st AC caught stealing railway bedrolls
content: A video circulating online shows passengers on the Purushottam Express allegedly stealing bedrolls from the First AC coach, causing widespread condemnation. Railway personnel confronted a family accused of packing bedsheets and towels, leading to a dispute. This incident highlights a new challenge for Indian Railways, already struggling with overcrowding and cleanliness, as passengers reportedly steal onboard property.

title: Social media influencer Shahajahan Shareef arrested for defaming Bengaluru in video
content: A social media influencer, S Shahajahan Shareef, has been arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly spreading fake news and defaming the city. She posted an old video from Uttar Pradesh, falsely claiming it depicted rowdyism in Bengaluru, causing public concern. Police investigations revealed the video's origin, leading to her arrest and the seizure of her devices.

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 4: There's a new No. 1

title: Trout hits towering 485-foot shot for 400th homer
content: the three-time American League Most Valuable Player and 11-time All-Star hits his 400th home run . the 485-foot solo shot to left-center field off a 98 mph sinker from rockies reliever Jaden Hill extended the Angels' lead to 3-0 . Trout entered the season with 378 career homers .

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 3
content: Mike Clay explains why fantasy managers should bench WR Jerry Jeudy in the Browns' week 3 matchup against the Packers . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and, of course, easily digestible fantasy advice .
